text: Bottled (0.5l) as Easter 14°P, 5.5% ABV. Slightly cloudy, light amber colored. AROMA- caramel, apricots, woody hops. FLAVOR- lightly sour, lightly sweet, moderately bitter, fruity, malty, touch of caramel, spicy and woody hops. Medium bodied.Good.

#614Bottle 0.5l from brewpub.Light amber body, medium white head. Aroma of caramel, apples, leaves, wood. Taste is bitter and slightly sweet, really bitter aftertaste. Caramel, hops, wood, apples. Medium body and carbonation. Good one. Much more polotmavý than pilsener.

Return trip to Strahov - feeling triumphant after the castle tour and long climb up the hill. Found a great corner booth shared table and settled in. Started with the Easter special - dry hopped version if I recall - a nice refreshing "hoppy" (thats your visit from the Easter punny - count it) beer for the occasion. Good start.

(tap 0,5l @ OP (Brno))
Aroma: Malty sweet, hops.
Appearance: Hazy, light golden color. Long lasting, white head.
Taste: Medium sweet, medium bitter, hops.
Palate: Medium-full body. Long, hoppy bitter finish.
Overall: Full, balanced, great. (1000. beer on RB)
5.8.2014. Keg at brewpub. Herbs on the nose, taste is also herbs, hops. Quite light and refreshing
Amber colour with white head and nice lancing. Malty taste with medium to full body. Bitter aftertaste.

5th Oct 2014. on-tap 0.4 litre pour at the brewpub: told it was their lager and 5.2% by the server: assume its this.

Amber with a mini haze and white topping. Malts lead the way in the aroma and taste, biscuity and light, some floral hops follow along. A mild citrus hint arrives in the mouth but this is predominantly a maltier brew than a hop dominated beer: nice enough blend I suppose but wanted more oomph. The finish was slightly bitter but enough to get excited about.

Vycap priamo na Strahove. Medena farba, Uzasna kremova biela pena, ktora vydrzala pocas celeho pitia. Vona sladova a zaroven sladka, ako kvetiny. Jemne citit chmel. Chut krasne vyvazena sladko - horka. Prijemne lahke telo. Pivo je velmi dobre pitelne. Vedel by som ich dat niekolko po sebe. Uzasna praca pana sladka.
Tap at the brewpub. Pours cloudy golden with nice white head. Aroma is malty, grassy, hoppy. Flavor is quite bitter, malt, hops, grass.

On tap @ pivovar Strahov. Giallo dorata lievemente velata con schiuma bianca fine e persistente. Aroma intenso floreale (camomilla) maltato , un po di miele dacacia e un po di fieno. Gusto dapprima dolce abboccato, poi amaricata con piacevole freschezza erbacea/floreale. Corpo medio non troppo carbonata grande equilibrio e grande armonia.
Bottle from brewery. Hazy orange golden color with thick off-white head. Malty, bready aroma with herbal hops. Taste, sweet malt, banana, yeast, Saaz hops. Bitter finish. Good.

Draught @ the brewpub. Pours slightly hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of malt, biscuit, grassy hops. Flavor is malt, little bread, light herbal, grapefruit peel, rich grassy hops. Medium body, soft carbonation, very bitter finish. Good stuff and dangerous easy drinking. 280313

Copper color with 2 finger head. Aroma of honey, malt, floral, spring garden, hops. Taste is light sweet and medium bitter. Light to medium body, creamy slick texture, soft to average carbonation. May be the best Pilsner I have had.

Klásterní Pivovar Strahov, Prága. Mély arany szín, hatalmas tömör hófehér hab. Illatában a finom malátás-füves aromák mellett nagyon érezhető a gyümölcsösség, ami aztán az ízében is előkerül, egyből a finom maláta után megy át almás, kicsit citrusos ízvilágba, és a komló is gyümölcsösen fut végig az ízlelőbimbókon, valamint a kenyeres, finom utóízében is érezhető. A 13-as testesség is érződik, egyáltalán nem veszti el karakterét még hosszabb italozás után sem, száraz, élénken szénsavas, tehát egy majdnem tökéletes, klasszikus cseh pilzeni, de nem is vártam mást ezen a helyen.
Draught at the brewpub. Hazy yellow beer with a white head. Wheat and banana aroma, apples, spices and alittle sourish. Wheat flavor, hoppy, spicy, peppery with some fruity notes.

Sample. Pours a clear golden beer with an offwhite head. The aroma is malt, yeast and hops with saaz. The flavor is malt and hops with saaz. The palate is bitterness with notes of malt. Overall a good beer.
Handbottled by Dedollewaitor, thanks. Pours golden with a white head. Aroma is malty and grassy hop. Flavour is malty, medium grassy hop. Nice.

Handbottle, thanks to DeDolleWaitor. Slightly hazy golden. Aroma of bready malt with grassy and herbal hops and a touch of fruit. Dry and malty flavour with a big hop flavour and a very bitter finish.

Draught @ Brewpub. Pours unclear dark yellow with a handsome creamy white head and lacings. Nose is fresh. Lots of straw and grass. Floral, crisp and smooth hoppy flavor. Dry lasting end. Refreshing and very nice! Incredible Pilsener!

On draught at the brewpub. The beer is a mostly clear orange-yellow color with a medium foamy off-white head that burns away steadily. Patches of lacing on the glass. Spicy Saaz hops aroma with notes of citrus and bready malt. Light, clean body with flavors of spiced hops, bready malts and orange rinds. The finish is fruity with a lingering Saaz hops aftertaste. Enjoyable from start to finish. When you see monks from the monastary across the street coming in to order something it must be good.

UPDATED: MAY 7, 2008 Back from a Czech Republic pub-crawl this is part of my express ratings for the typical Světlý 11°- (Czech light Pils), Světlý 12°+ (Czech Pils), Polotmavý (Czech Amber Lagers) and Tmavý (Czech Black Lagers).  Non-typical beers will receive personalized descriptions after the express ratings.-------- />
How: Tap at brewpub (Klásterní Pivovar Strahov, Prague)
The look: Cloudy golden body with a large white head
To me a typical Czech Světlý 12° and above is: Well malted body with plenty of biscuits and cereals.  Sweetness level is in the light-medium range with some honey flavours and a light caramel presence (3/4 honey, 1/4 caramel).  Fruity flavour limited to a light citrus flavour.  Medium carbonation.  Finish is dry and moderately bitter with a light citric touch.  After-taste of dry grassy/herbal hops with a light dry spiciness character.
This one: As above, but more intense, perfect balance, perfect everything.  My favourite standard (non-oak barrel aged) pilsner ever.  Puts my beloved Amère À Boire to shame.

En fût. Pinte dégustée directement à la brasserie. Arôme: Forte présence dhoublon avec une pointe de pêches. Apparence: La couleur est blonde orangée. Saveur: Goût dhoublons légèrement amer et de céréales. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Amertume dhoublon en arrière goût. (Rating #1514)

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2009 My Bottom Line:
Spicy, grassy, piney Saaz soars out of the sturdy biscuity hay, leading to a blooming herbal hop finale where balance resides and quenching is epitomized. Intense enjoyment is inevitable with this quality of Bohemian Pilsener as far as Im concerned.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A De Dolle-like tower of foam mushrooms over the opaque orangey blond.
-Effervescence is frothy and serves the plentiful flavors quite well.
-I love it when equilibrium is reached through muscular flavoring and effortless drinkability.
-This is a truly complex and festive beer, but it has the amazing ability to make you want to stop analyzing it.

On tap at the brewpub.

draught at the brewpub. Deep golden colour, hazy, enorumously large and creamy head. Intesnively hoppy in a very pleasant way, full-bodied with a solid and tasty malty base. Lovely - ceske pivo jak ma byt!

UPDATED: APR 20, 2010 At the brewery again. Dark hazy amber with a billow of suds. Tangy Saaz and something subtly citrusy/mandarin-accented. Wafery afters. Citrus aroma with sneaking sulphur. A bit different, distinctively hopped, still retains its Czechness..

Draught at Klasterni Pivovar Strahov, Praha.
Pours a nice hazy golden colour with creamy white head and ordinary pils nose. The aroma is very malty and hoppy with pleasant bitter Saaz hop notes. Moderate sweet but watery finish, otherwise very nice brew.

Draught at the brewpub. (Again a bit different than this. Displayed as: Speciální svetlé pivo, Easter, 13°, ABV 5,3%). Light strawyellow - white head. Fruity, flowery, medium bitterness, citrus, citruscest, light yeasty. A very sudden bitter finish. Lasting bitterness - citrus-bitter.

On draught, at the brewpub: Deep golden to orangey coloured, medium-sized stable and lacing white head, cloudy, traces of wort and peaches in the strong, aromatic - Saaz hops - resinous nose, strong bitter-sweet flavour, light to medium bodied, gentle MF, fine Saaz hops, sticking to the tongue, in the dry, lingering bitter finish. A very well made, beautiful hoppy brew............
P.S. This beer is different from the 14º Easter Special, because of the lower gravity and the lower ABV.........
